item.title: Richard Slayman, the man who received a genetically modified pig kidney in an unprecedented transplant at a Boston hospital, has died.
item.description: Richard Slayman, the man who received a genetically modified pig kidney in an unprecedented transplant at a Boston hospital, has died.

item.title: Nearly 60% of Argentines are living in poverty, up from 44% when Javier Milei was inaugurated as president in December, according to the Catholic University.
item.description: Nearly 60% of Argentines are living in poverty, up from 44% when Javier Milei was inaugurated as president in December, according to the Catholic University.

item.title: Putin nominated an economist to succeed Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu, a longtime ally, in the most substantial shake-up to Russia's military command structure since Moscow launched its war on Ukraine.
item.description: Putin nominated an economist to succeed Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu, a longtime ally, in the most substantial shake-up to Russia’s military command structure since Moscow launched its war on Ukraine.

item.title: More seaborne migrants are reaching the U.S., with illegal entries or attempted entries by boat in California more than doubling over a three-year period, according to Customs and Border Protection.
item.description: More seaborne migrants are reaching the U.S., with illegal entries or attempted entries by boat in California more than doubling over a three-year period, according to Customs and Border Protection.

item.title: Israeli troops pressed farther into Rafah and engaged in fierce fighting in previously cleared areas around Gaza City, showing the difficulty of winning a decisive victory over Hamas as a guerrilla force.
item.description: Israeli troops pressed farther into Rafah and engaged in fierce fighting in previously cleared areas around Gaza City, showing the difficulty of winning a decisive victory over Hamas as a guerrilla force.

item.title: Justice Kavanaugh called for the Supreme Court to hear more cases, suggesting an increase to 75 annually from the 60 or so that have become the norm in recent years.
item.description: Justice Kavanaugh called for the Supreme Court to hear more cases, suggesting an increase to 75 annually from the 60 or so that have become the norm in recent years.

item.title: How China's 'Firewater' Became the World's Most Valuable Liquor Brand
item.description: Moutai is the world’s largest beverage company by market cap, yet it remains largely obscure among global consumers. WSJ looks at the liquor giant’s business strategies and the challenges ahead.

item.title: Russia's Bombardment of Ukraine Is More Lethal Than Ever
item.description: Ukraine is shooting down a far smaller proportion of Russian missile attacks than it was earlier in the war as its enemy launches more harder-to-hit weapons.

item.title: Temu Cools on the U.S. After Shelling Out Billions
item.description: The Chinese-owned bargain app is looking to reduce reliance on American shoppers as growth slows and scrutiny of TikTok grows.

item.title: China to Start Ultralong Treasury Bond Sale
item.description: China’s finance ministry said it will start selling the first batch of a planned 1 trillion yuan worth of ultralong special treasury bonds Friday, as Beijing looks to provide more support to the world’s second-largest economy.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
Suddenly There Aren't Enough Babies. The Whole World Is Alarmed.
item.description: B​irthrates are falling fast across countries, ​with economic, social and geopolitical ​consequences. “The demographic winter is coming.”

item.title: Separation (Monday Crossword, May 13)
What's News: Business & Finance
Pepper…and Salt
Ford hired Sherry House, formerly chief financial officer of electric-vehicle maker Lucid, to be its next CFO.
item.description: Ford hired Sherry House, formerly chief financial officer of electric-vehicle maker Lucid, to be its next CFO.

item.title: Consumer-facing brands with spots to place have so far been disappointed in their hope that the rise of ad-supported streaming would compensate for the decline of traditional television.
item.description: Consumer-facing brands with spots to place have so far been disappointed in their hope that the rise of ad-supported streaming would compensate for the decline of traditional television.

item.title: Competitors trying to interpret Tesla's plans for its fast EV chargers sense a potential market opening, though there is no obvious No. 2 in the race to build a U.S. highway network.
item.description: Competitors trying to interpret Tesla’s plans for its fast EV chargers sense a potential market opening, though there is no obvious No. 2 in the race to build a U.S. highway network.

item.title: Six years after 2U was riding high on a $5 billion-plus market cap and a fistful of contracts, the debt-laden education-technology company's valuation has plunged and it faces an existential crisis.
item.description: Six years after 2U was riding high on a $5 billion-plus market cap and a fistful of contracts, the debt-laden education-technology company’s valuation has plunged and it faces an existential crisis.

item.title: Workers at a unionized Apple retail store near Baltimore voted to authorize a strike as contract talks with the company continue.
item.description: Workers at a unionized Apple retail store near Baltimore voted to authorize a strike as contract talks with the company continue.
